Sales Representative

Company Name Elders Company Location Pakenham, AU

New Posted Date Posted 15 hours ago Number of views 6 views

Be an early applicant

Job description


  • Exciting agricultural sales role
  • Outstanding customer service; experience in sales
  • Based in Pakenham; iconic brand

Elders has played a key role in rural Australia for more than 175 years. As a leading agribusiness, we are committed to providing our clients with a solution that meets their needs across every aspect of their farming business. We are committed to delivering value to the local communities in which we operate and the future of Australia’s agricultural industry.

The Role

Apply your expertise in agricultural chemical products and the farming sector for the purposes of building strong client relationships to achieve sales and earnings targets by

  • Providing timely and accurate advice and recommendations about farm supplies
  • Performing farm supplies sales and quotes
  • Identifying and developing sales opportunities and referrals
  • Assisting in the storage, handling, receiving and dispatching of stock

Reporting to the Farm Supplies Sales Manager, this role will liaise with people from across the business and will play an active role in representing Elders in campaigns, field days, community events and forums.

The Person

  • Previous sales experience and, ideally, a successful sales record in a rural farm supplies business
  • Committed to the provision of high-quality customer service;
  • Possess an understanding of agriculture products;
  • Understanding your clients’ current and future needs, the region and our competitors;
  • Demonstrated high-quality written and verbal communication and customer service skills;
  • Ability to work independently and have good time management skills;
  • Although not essential, a qualification in an agricultural or related business discipline will be highly regarded.

This is a great opportunity to join a dedicated team, who is passionate about Australian agribusiness.

Apply now for this unique opportunity or for more information call Peter Rollason, Branch Manager on 0419 600 323.

Applications close 16 September 2018

At Elders, we want our people to reflect the communities we operate in, and encourage applications from a diverse range of people, backgrounds and experiences. We encourage a positive work-life balance through a range of flexible work options.

Elders are directly sourcing for this position, therefore we respectfully request no recruitment agency applications.

[

Remote Maritime Doctors

Company Name Aspen Medical Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 10 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Description

Aspen Medical is seeking Expressions of Interest (EOI) from Remote Maritime Doctors to provide clinical services to the Australian Border and Protection Service.

Aspen Medical has been engaged by the ACBPS to provide medical support on board a number of Australian Customs Vessels for missions which generally operate for approximately 28 days. This is not your standard Medical Officer role and as such we are seeking candidates who are looking for something a little different.

We are seeking a Medical Practitioner with a broad range of skills who can operate in very remote and sometimes difficult conditions. As the Remote Maritime Doctor you will be required to manage a broad range of contingencies without the support of an on board medical team. You will use your broad range of medical training and experience to respond to and treat all types of medical emergencies and issues which may arise during the voyage. This role offers the opportunity to showcase your adaptability and experience across a range of potential medical situations.

Perhaps you are seeking to expand your professional experience; seeking exposure to a different and exciting role; or just a change in your working environment for a short period of time. Whatever your motivation, we welcome a confidential conversation with you.

Experience, Qualifications And Documentation Required

In addition to being able to meet Aspen Medical's credentialing requirements, you will need to hold (or be eligible to gain) a current Baseline Security Clearance and an Employment Suitability Clearance. In order to be eligible for these clearances you must be an Australian Citizen. A current Early Management of Severe Trauma (EMST) certification is also a must for this role.

Contact Information

Misty Horne

Full-time

Business Development Manager

Company Name Ploy Company Location Melbourne, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 13 hours ago Number of views 24 views

Job description

Who are Ploy?

The market would classify us as an ‘advanced start –up’… What that means in reality, is that in just over 5 years we’ve already started operating in APAC, have been recognised as a Tier 1 provider to some of the worlds leading organisations and are in conversations with clients about redefining their service lines, all based on a new way of working.

\xa0

So how have we done it?

\xa0

Ploy connects the ‘gig economy’ with task-oriented assignments across Australia. Whether you're looking for work, or looking to hire, we bring you stacks of options.

Having recently grown into Asia, Ploy continues to act as a trusted partner to our clients – acting as a true extension of their service lines. Spanning from project outsourcing to professional services, Ploy pride themselves on building durable, innovative and new solutions to the modern marketplace.

\xa0

Our unique solution allows us to provide clients with a quality, flexible, and purpose-built workforce that streamlines business requirements, making life simpler and more profitable. Better still; Ploy manages everything end to end from talent mapping to project delivery.

\xa0

Who are you?

\xa0

This is a tricky one ... and we're open! Personality is key, along with a genuine desire to learn and be part of something different. This role will see you acting as a true brand ambassador to both clients and stakeholders, as well as providing complex solutions to the market.

Ploy is relatively new to the market, as is our solution, meaning educating our clients is key! A background in managing customer/ clients/ suppliers and setting expectations would be great. This will be challenging a times but truly rewarding when a great solution comes together!

If you're from a recruitment background and are looking for a change from repetitive recruitment processes, more flexibility, a chance to step up without taking a full business development role and above all, to be treated like an adult in charge of your own time management, then this could be for you.

\xa0

What will you do?

\xa0

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Acquire, develop and manage accounts, building strong relationships and delivering results

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Present, develop, articulate & deliver value propositions to clients

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Manage momentum through the sales cycle

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Negotiating & Identifying opportunities

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Developing strategies with clients, covering projects, recruitment, professional services\xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 and company branding

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Researching market trends and pursuing qualified leads

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Network, network, network

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Partnering with Solutions team, executing client requests and building sustainable\xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 solutions

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Sitting across LinkedIn, Facebook & Twitter you will act as the voice of Ploy; responding to\xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 contractors/ clients comments, encouraging engagement and measuring success

\xb7 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 Working with Ploy vendors (i.e. LinkedIn), you will attend meetings to understand new\xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 product releases, new trends within social media and networking events (with the Ploy\xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0 team!)

Track & Civil Design Engineer

Company Name Metro Trains Melbourne Company Location Melbourne, AU

New Posted Date Posted 12 hours ago Number of views 25 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Melbourne Rail Network | Design Production Team – Office of the Chief Engineer
  • Broad variety and scale of projects across the rail spectrum to strengthen your design skills.
  • Exciting new team established to deliver a ten year contract.


About Metro

We operate and maintain Melbourne’s Metropolitan train network. Successfully transporting over 400,000 passengers per day is achieved by our large dedicated workforce. With multiple large projects being completed, we continually work hand-in-hand with all external businesses involved to ensure that new assets comply with the standards we set.

A part of the Safety, Engineering & Environment division, the Office of The Chief Engineer supports all operational areas in designing solutions and governing the standards set to operate a safe and reliable railway.

The Position

Responsibilities Will Include

As Track & Civil Designer, you will support the Design Production team with engineering and technical activities that culminate in the delivery of track & civil packages.
  • Track & Civil design activities leading to the delivery of IFC packages. Designs typically relate to track alignment, formation, earthworks, drainage, level and pedestrian crossings, combined services routes etc
  • Be actively involved in Safety in Design, risk assessments, and peer reviews
  • Identify and assist the resolution of design standard or operational requirements non-conformances
  • Provide technical advice on projects to other officers/divisions and external parties
  • Report to the Track & Structures Design Production Manager


Requirements

You will demonstrate previous experience and knowledge of track & civil design within a rail environment. The type of renewals projects within the Metropolitan Rail Network are varied, scaled from large to small projects - experience across a wide range of track & civil rail infrastructure is preferred.

You value the importance of teamwork and balancing the requirements of different stakeholders. You are confident to challenge your peers and make a difference. You are open minded in bringing innovation to the table. Consultative approaches to providing solutions, mixed with sound people skills are critical attributes you’ve demonstrated over your career.

Ideally you’re seeking an environment where your career growth is developed – with continual progression to become a well-rounded rail professional.

Benefits
  • All Metro Employees receive a free Myki pass that allows free Public Transport in Victoria
  • Metro supports work/life balance with opportunities to work from home on occasion
  • Melbourne is currently home to the largest rail infrastructure projects in Australia that will boast long term employment and future career opportunities

Ready to apply?

Please submit your application by clicking ‘Apply Now’ before 11am Thursday 27th September 2018 Please direct all queries to Ben George, Talent Acquisition Specialist on 0437 025 786.

Metro Trains is an equal opportunity employer and embraces diversity. We encourage all interested applicants to apply but only applications with the right to live and work in Australia will be considered for this position.

Stakeholder Engagement Advisor - Melbourne

Company Name ARTC Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 25 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Marketing / PR / Events
  • Marketing / PR / Events - Other
  • Melbourne
  • Permanent / Full Time

31/8/2018
  • Melbourne, Victoria
  • Iconic Inland Rail Project - Keeping the nation moving

ARTC plays a critical role in the transport supply chain and in the overall economic development of Australia. ARTC is one of Australia's largest rail network owners.

The Inland Rail Programme is a 1710km rail infrastructure project stretching from Melbourne to Brisbane incorporating new and existing rail track. In Victoria the programme involves the enhancement of existing standard gauge track to cater for double stacking container trains.

More information relating to the project can be found here: http://inlandrail.artc.com.au.

This roles will be based on Melbourne.

About The Position

The Stakeholder Engagement Advisor supports the Inland Rail programme through effective delivery of stakeholder and community engagement across Victoria. Reporting to a Stakeholder Engagement Lead, this role will support the implementation of best practice community and stakeholder engagement plans and drive engagement with communities and other stakeholders.
The Advisor will be part of a cohesive team and will be mentored and coached by some of the most highly regarded professionals.

About You

To be successful in this role, you will have a desire to work in a fast-paced environment. You will be a creative thinker and possess problem-solving skills. The ideal candidate will have high level verbal and written communication skills together with an ability to work with diverse stakeholders in sensitive environments. 864789654:
[

UX Designer / Product Designer | Lead Our Design Practice | $120k-$140k + Super

Company Name affix Company Location Melbourne, Australia

Posted Date Posted 3 days ago Number of views 162 views

Job description

Ahhhh Product Design… What the hell is it!? Is it UX? Is it more UI? Is it a weird mix of both, plus a bit of research just for fun? Well, before we get all heavy into the “titles in design” debate, I think that question really depends on the maturity of the design practice within the individual business and how much passion, energy and ownership the whole team\xa0have in design as a core discipline. So, whilst I can’t tell you what the role of a Product Designer is in every company will look like, I can absolutely tell you what impact, autonomy and influence you’re gonna’ have as a Product Designer with this awesome SaaS Tech Scale-up...\xa0

What’s the product, vision and crew like? \xa0

These guys have been around since 2012. In that time, they’ve grown from a team of 3-25, helped millions of people be more effective at work, formed partnerships with tech heavyweights like Microsoft, been the #1 app on the Windows store; oh and seen global success in their first product.

\xa0

So, if they’re already successful, is this role just a design babysitter? – HELL NO!!!

\xa0

The start-up spirit that galvanised them - has never left. So, born out of the research, feedback and learning from their first, they’re back with a new, ambitious SaaS product and that’s where you come in…

\xa0

What Impact will you have as a Product Designer?

\xa0

Your role will be to lead the design practice. Defining what great design at all levels in the business looks like across native iOS, Windows and Web. You’ll drive impact by

\xa0

  • Working collaboratively with Product Managers & Software Engineers in the discovery and execution of design opportunities through workshops, co-design practices and design sprints.
  • Conducting user research and interviews to leverage insights and uncover real user problems and opportunities to improve our products
  • Exploring user problems via flows, wireframes, designs and prototypes before putting them in front of users
  • Ensuring interfaces remain high quality, functional and cohesive across different platforms (Native iOS, Windows & Web)\xa0\xa0

\xa0

What does “Design” mean to this team? - that's an\xa0awesome question!

\xa0

Design as a practice with this crew has evolved immensely in the last 12 months. They’re now at a point where the team genuinely values the core tenants of design. Their engineering team now expect a design-led investigation into new feature development. They get involved in workshops, they voice their opinions, and believe in rapid prototyping, experimentation and regular validation with users, in order to make mistakes in design – rather than in the code.

\xa0

Like any practice, they’re still on a journey…But they need a champion like you to continue to drive the journey forward… \xa0

\xa0

What skills & experience you’ll bring from your past:


  • 5+ years of experience designing digital products working across multiple platforms with experience delivering solutions across native (iOS/Android) and Web Platforms
  • Full product design skill spanning: user experience, visual design, information architecture, experience flows, wireframing and prototyping (multi-fidelity)
  • Confidence in your design practice and how design strategically impacts a business
  • An open attitude and confidence in collaborating with product managers, engineers and leadership teams
  • Experience with usability testing and user research methods
  • Solid understanding of technical requirements and a basic understanding of limitations of web platforms, native mobile (iOS/Android) apps.\xa0

\xa0

The role of a Product Designer in this team will vary, so being able to flex up and down will be necessary, but in the main, activities will be split a bit like this:

\xa0

  • 20% Research
  • 40 % UX Design
  • 40% UI Design

\xa0

The Why? - What’s in it for you?

Well, this one is a real opportunity for you to own a design practice from scratch. Have your say in not only the what\xa0gets designed, but the why\xa0too. You’ll get to touch service design, product design, UX, IA and interaction design, with have full autonomy to lead, experiment and ultimately craft rich experiences for global users.

I’m not gonna’ lie. This role is crucial for the next phase of growth in the business and so whilst I’m not a fan of dot points, here’s a few to show you how we’ll help you impact your future:

\xa0

  • Autonomy to lead the design practice at a globally recognised tech scale up
  • Design for cutting-edge platforms across iOS, UWP and Web
  • The opportunity to work on an innovative product with huge global potential
  • Supportive flexible work arrangements that provide you with the balance you deserve
  • Easy-going, social environment with shared values that will enable you the courage to fail fast and have fun as you embrace new challenges in a safe, inclusive environment

\xa0

As ever, there’s a tonne more to tell you about this role, if you want to find out more, please give me a shout and I’ll gladly run you through all the details, answer any questions you have up front and hopefully grab a coffee.

Looking forward to chatting to you soon! - sam.rice@affix.com.au or 0416 404 428\xa0

Product Manager, Term Deposits

Company Name ME Bank Company Location Melbourne, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 19 hours ago Number of views 58 views

Job description


Let's talk about ME
We're not like other banks.

ME was created by the industry super funds to be different from the pack \xad- and we're passionate about staying that way as we head into an exciting and progressive future.

We are building a bank, a company and a brand that we can be proud of - but to achieve that, we need the best people. To help ME get there, you'll challenge the status quo and share extraordinary ideas - and our size guarantees you'll have the opportunity, support, and environment to be heard.

ME's core purpose is helping all Australians get ahead - no conditions, asterisks or exceptions.

We believe everyone deserves the same opportunities in life, regardless of gender or identity, sexuality, ethnicity or religion. This is why we're so committed to an equal opportunity workplace - because we know our success won't come from focusing on similarities, but by embracing and celebrating our diversity.


Let's talk about the JOB
The role is accountable for the overall product management of the term deposit portfolio and sits within the Deposit Product Management team. This team, alongside Home Loans and Credit Cards, makes up the Product Management functionality of the Bank.

With your previous product management experience in banking, when you first you start in this role the primary focus will be to deliver on strategic product changes to re-platform the product suite and help make for smoother, more efficient operations across the product value chain.

Then as the product SME, you will continue to optimise the products and product processes through data and insights, whilst ensuring the product portfolio is well managed in accordance with best practice product management disciplines.

You will also be using your experience around managing product financials as you'll be working closely with the pricing manager to monitor the portfolio FUM movements, interest rates and industry changes.


Let's talk about YOU
You always take a hands-on approach to your work and when it comes to solving problems, you are an analytical thinker and are able to take a holistic view of the issue by finding out the cause, and then really delving in to why it happened and most importantly- determining and implementing the optimal solution. "Initiative" is your middle name, as you naturally have a knack for 'lifting the hood' to get to the bottom of things and taking the steps to fix it - and you do all this with ease and grace.

Being a self-starter, you're a go-getter who understands customer needs as they relate to market and industry changes, and having had experience around developing and implementing product improvement and optimisation projects, you have a knack for comprehending the financial drivers of banking products.

With your extensive expertise across financial services, you have solid experience developing and implementing product strategies, including product development. Having strong documentation and presentation skills, will really help you to hit the ground running and shine in this role.


About the Perks

 At ME, we believe that work should be a place that you can make the most of - and these are just some of the many reasons why people love it here:

  • Popular culture - that's not a claim, we've got the data to prove it. We genuinely care about each other and work in an encouraging and collaborative environment.
  • The whole package - sure, we're going to reward you well with your salary package - but there are also lots of other perks - including discounted Myki travel cards, free health support, conveniently-located offices, plus much more.
  • Not afraid to fail? We embrace action-oriented people like you. That's right, you can make mistakes here and it's ok - so long as you learn from them.
  • To be ME, we need you - we're building something really cool and you get to directly influence what that is.
  • ProudlyME - our internal pride network - has a swag of initiatives that show support, education, and passion toward our team and customers, demonstrating that ME is a strong advocate on equal rights for the LGBTIQ+ community.
  • Meet the Execs - our Executive team is fun and full of passion because we know great managers mean happy staff.


Oh, and did we mention you get your very own ME branded Converse High-top shoes? Now that's a reason to get your foot in the door.


I was born to play this role

 If this sounds like the perfect job for you, why wait? Apply now by submitting your cover letter and resume today.

[

Senior Quality Advisor

Company Name Metso Company Location Melbourne, AU

New Posted Date Posted 16 hours ago Number of views 18 views

Be an early applicant

Job description



    • It all begins with active personal involvement – curiosity. Why can’t things be done differently, better or maybe simpler? Over the years, curiosity builds knowledge.

    We utilize knowledge and hands-on attitude to make the big difference to our customers. Be part of a friendly and professional team in a global workplace. With us, you will be working with world-leading process industry solutions in a result-driven and respectful culture.

    Due to our continuous improvement strategies, Metso Australia has identified the need for a motivated quality professional to support quality management activities and engagement within the business.

    You will be a confident and accomplished quality professional with experience in building a quality culture, the development and implementation of quality processes, investigating non-conformances and implementing corrective actions.

    This challenging role will be based in Newcastle/Perth and will report to the General Manager - Safety, Quality and Training.

    About The Role

    In this role some of your key responsibilities will include;
    • Lead and support key influencers, including managers on strategies to foster an organisational culture that prioritises quality management and process improvement
    • Support all business areas to apply ISO 9001 2015 principles. This includes supporting business areas understanding of their context, interested parties and risks and opportunities.
    • Supporting the development and improvement of processes and activities to manage risk and exploit opportunities. Ensure Plan, Do, Check, Act (PDCA) operating principles are applied.
    • Communicate, engage with and influence decision makers and other stakeholders to optimise quality management across the business.
    • Support all product line investigations (including root cause analysis) on internal and externally supplied non-conformances, field problems and warranty claims. Lead complex investigations at the request of senior management.
    • Support all business areas in the completion of corrective and preventative actions.
    • Develop and lead processes for monitoring, measuring, evaluating and reporting quality performance
    • Auditing of compliance to ISO 9001 2015 as required. Auditing compliance to other standards or quality KPI’s at the direction of senior management.


    About You

    Essential Criteria
    • Significant quality experience in a manufacturing, engineering, workshop or mining service environment
    • A strong understanding and working knowledge of quality management principles, Australian standards, international standards and codes of practice
    • Experience in conducting quality investigations by applying established investigation methodologies.
    • Lead auditor qualifications
    • Current motor vehicle license.
    • Ability to pass alcohol and other drug tests.
    • Ability to travel regularly domestically
    • Excellent English communication skills
    • Ability to manage competing priorities
    • Demonstrated ability to work effectively in team
    • Excellent problem solving and negotiation skills.

    Desirable
    • Degree in engineering, a mechanical trade qualification (or equivalent) or significant technical experience
    • Some exposure to a global matrix organisation


    Job Benefits & Perks

    Metso Australia offers a fast paced, energetic culture along with
    • Company funded life and income protection insurance when electing the Company's default fund.
    • Discount on private health insurance through HBF and Bupa
    • Loyalty rewards, including additional annual leave provisions and monetary rewards, and much more.

    Metso is a world-leading industrial company offering equipment and services for the sustainable processing and flow of natural resources in the mining, aggregates, recycling and process industries. With our unique knowledge and innovative solutions, we help our customers improve their operational efficiency, reduce risks and increase profitability. Metso is listed on the Nasdaq Helsinki in Finland and had sales of about EUR 2.7 billion in 2017. Metso employs over 12,000 people in more than 50 countries.
